album.title: Everybody Else Is Doing It, So Why Can't We?

wiki.content: "Linger" is a song composed by Irish musicians Dolores O'Riordan and Noel Hogan of the rock band The Cranberries. The song, which has an acoustic arrangement featuring a string section, became the band's first major hit, peaking at #3 in the Republic of Ireland, #8 in the US and #14 in the UK. In the documentary '99 Love Life & Rock 'n' Roll, O'Riordan says that the song is about her first serious kiss."Linger" was listed as #86 on the VH1's 100 Greatest Songs of the 90s. As of January 2010 this is playing 'Linger' here. Previous contributors have posted that "This song is "Dreams" not "Linger". [br]It will only play as "Linger" if you add it to your library and proceed to listen to your library station; just hope it comes up." This has either been corrected, or 'Dreams' is also tagged here. If you get 'Dreams' instead, try following the suggestion immediately above User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
wiki.summary: "Linger" is a song composed by Irish musicians Dolores O'Riordan and Noel Hogan of the rock band The Cranberries. The song, which has an acoustic arrangement featuring a string section, became the band's first major hit, peaking at #3 in the Republic of Ireland, #8 in the US and #14 in the UK. In the documentary '99 Love Life & Rock 'n' Roll, O'Riordan says that the song is about her first serious kiss."Linger" was listed as #86 on the VH1's 100 Greatest Songs of the 90s.
